Operation British and Battle of Loum
failed to force Federation to surrender
thus Zeon began Earth Landing Operations.
Klaus and I participated in second drop,
and as auxillary to 2nd Terrestial Mobile Division
we landed on surface.
Invasion blitzkrieg secured resource rich areas
and military bases.
During that time, we were assigned
to new MS platoon brought down to surface.
No longer under direct army command
we participated in fighting all around the front.
When Federal army started to distrupt
long months of stalemate
my worn out "Brauer's Platoon"
was reinforced with new operator
and experienced MS pilot.
In Europe,
after suspicious EFF troop movement,
sporadic fights broke out at the end of October.
It was clerly a diversionary tactic.
Information about feedie MS we have encountered
was not published by decision of our higher-ups.
Most Zeon soldiers
continue to believe only Zeon posseses Mobile Suit,
newest and most powerful weapon of this war.
If you ask me,
unconfirmed rumors cause a sense of anxiety...
and considering confusion which will arise
after first encounter
I believe that high command should have
properly announced new development.
Well, I suppose
people in space can't sense atmoshpehere
on muddy battlefield down here...
Zeon has lost its largest resource base
in a major Federation counteroffensive
which broke nine months of stalemate.
Colonel M'Quve quickly abandoned Odessa
and escaped to space.
It is said that resources sent from here back to space
will be enough to fuel our war effor for 10 years,
but its the soldiers on front lines that will fight this war,
including us...
In reality, there is no chance
we could withstand such long war.
Loss of Odessa will have great impact on future battles,
not just because of resource extraction capacity,
but because our forces, which were defending it,
has suffered extensive losses
and our chain of command felt into confusion.
I could fell ground battle turning into chaos
with our forces abandoning front
to escape encirclement of Odessa
without any coordination...
We became a guerilla unit,
acting independently
and on our own judgement.
The collapse of European front continues,
with many units escaping into space
or retreating toward Africa or Far East
In order to help as many friendly unit as possible
escape safely, and rebuild the front lines,
we have decided to throughly gather information
and intervene wherever support is required.
This is our duty now.

California Base, one of largest bases
of our Terrestial forces.
It is large scale complex
of all three branches of military,
land, sea, and air forces.
It contains space catapult as well
as weapons development centre.
It was originally Federation base,
but was successfully captured
with almost no damage during
Second Earth Drop Operation.
After our crushing defeat in Europe
our continued war effort on suraface
and chance for counterattack
depends on survival of this base.
Lhasa Base, Zeon stonghold in Far East
its also where Apsaras is being built.
This is one of our ground bases
where research and development
of new weapons is being done.
It is believed that once completed
our newest Mobile Armor, Apsaras
will grant us our longest wish
of destroying EFF HQ in Jaburo.
But reality is not that simple
there is no way for single machine
to turn the tides of war.
With current situation down here
it is understandable for such
wishfull thinking to occur...
Late November
Zeon prepares for EFF space offensive
by shifting forces to defense line
between Granada moon base and
space fortresses Solomon and A Baoa Qu
At the moment
ground forces are effectively cut off.
Marooned on unfamiliar ground
and unable to resupply
soldiers exhaustion increased every day...
In the midst of all of this
we got report of a supply drop
heading for California Base,
our last link to space,
giving soldiers a glimmer of hope.

In meantime, Lhasa Base

If it falls, both Europe and Far East
will fall into Federation hands...
Investigation by Mad Angler squadron
under leadership of Char Aznalbe, the Red Comet,
has discovered an exact location
of entrance to EFF HQ at Jaburo.
In response
decision was made to launch full offensive
with all forces gathered at California Base.
It is clear, that this battle
will decide fate of Zeon ground forces...
If we win,
military balance will be in our favor once again.
If we fail...
we'll lose most of our remaining forces
and won't be able to resist EFF clean-up ops.
This strategy is nothing more than a gamble...
Our unit achieved its first goal
of reducing enemy surface defenses
and finally entered Jaburo interior.
Inside of Jaburo
is a vast underground complex
filling spacious limestone caves.
Despite being captivated by beauty of nature
we navigated through dimly lit labyrinths
to achieve victory...
Zeon's assault on Jaburo
ended up in disaster...
Most of our forces were defeat on ground,
and only few of them managed to infiltrate.
But even those lucky few
were mostly destroyed by Federation MS forces.
The facilities we succeeded in destroying
were only smart part of Jaburo,
and in the end its won't stop
Federation crushing momentum...
Due to that failure, situation on surface
is only going to get worse for us.
At the moment, however,
getting our remaining forces out alive
is our only goal...
Having lost most of ground forces
from California Base in disaster at Jaburo
Zeon no longer had any strength
to withstand Federation offensive.
Federation, on other hand,
successfully launched rebuilt space fleet
and begun final campaign in space...
I wish they'd left us alone
but Federation is not obliging
and is preparing for mop-up
of Zeon ground forces.
Well, if other side is still motivated
I'm going to fight until the end.

Lhasa Base, Zeon's Far East stronghold,
is under siege by Federation forces
However, Federation forces were dealt
devastating blow by Apsaras counterattack
that had been developed in secret there.
Curently, only small Federation research team

According to our intel, there is secret

...you can guess whats inside.

Lines: California Base
largest base of Zeon terrestial army.
However, it's only a matter
of time until it falls.
As for me, I don't plan to let
my friends die in such place.
With attack on Jaburo ending as failure
we stand no chance on ground.
Honestly, I think we should decide
on hiding place and lay low until
our guys in space can turn the tide of war.
But there is no way our Captain would do that...
Well, if I'm with those guys
even death doesnt sound so bad.
While on our way to Africa
we received distress call from
friendly unit stranded in desert.
It would be easier if we could use Gau
but most of them were lost in Jaburo
and even Klaus was unable to obtain more.
We somehow managed to obtain Gallop
and decided to lead overland retreat.
However, this area was in path of Feedies
gathering up for mop-up of Zeon forces.
It's been long time since we had such hard job...
Thanks to Tord sacrifice
we managed to escape from California Base
on the brink of defeat...
On the ground
only African front was holding on
against Federation onslaught.
In order to escape to space
we abandoned our Gau
and decided on capturing Federation transport
to be able to move covertly...
By middle of December
Federation sweep of California Base
and African front have eached their peek.
In the face of overwhelming forces
Zeon ground troops were on brink of destruction.
However, in countless mines of Africa
Zeon forces built underground bases.
Most were already tightly closed,
bidding their time for counterattack
which would come one day...
This made those bases
very hard to capture or even detect
leaving Federation no choice but to ignore them.
Our unit, having no way to remain in combat
took up residence in one of such bases
and went into hiding.
Apparently, it's not going to be easy until the end...
We are on our way to Nort Pole
where Federation space port is located
in hope of escaping back to space.
Even if we could get back to space
I'm not sure if we can reach safety
of Moon or neutral Side 6.
Despite watchful eyes of Federation
we can't give up on our last chance.
However, I can't stop thinking
what if there is still something
that I could accomplish on surface?
Tord...
please, watch over us...
Universal Century 0079 is coming to an end
soon December 0080 will begin.
I thought we had closed it on good note...
I'm sorry...
but you'll have to bear with me a little longer
Our mining base was discovered in the end
and fully encircled by enemy trops
landing from Indian Ocean...
Fortunately, due to what we accomplished,
we have found a base that will accept us
once our escape is successful.
Now, this is really going to be our last battle...
